group_1.textLeft: The existence of Magical Girls@is hidden so unnaturally from the world.

group_1.narration: And the more I looked into past history,@the more my doubts grew@about my uneasiness regarding environments.
Nothing but the glorious events@of prominent historical women are ever spoken of.@Anything amounting to the truth of what we call Magical Girls@is written off as nothing but personal stories.
Closing the book to signify the end of a story,@you could say.

group_1.textRight: Then Rabi's group was forced to put an end@to their actions...?
Concealing the existence of Magical Girls as a result...
If so, then by what...?

group_1.textLeft: ...By the will of the universe.

group_1.narration: Without energy from Magical Girls,@the universe will eventually become unsustainable.@That's like a disease to the universe itself.
Leaving us,@those who act out of favor to the universe,@as something akin to cancer cells of the universe.@It wouldn't be out of place to thus be@exterminated by an unseen force...

group_1.textCenter: (It pains me to be suspicious of Papa, but...)
(Perhaps the weight of so many unfortunate failures@has left him weak-hearted...?)
(I thought a short walk would help me@settle my mind, but it hasn't done a thing...)

group_1.textRight: Nayuta...?

group_1.textLeft: Oh... Rabi's mother...

group_1.textRight: Sleep well last night?

group_1.textLeft: Yes.
The cooking was delicious as well.@You have a very lovely inn.

group_1.textRight: Glad to hear it...
I'm indebted to both Professor Satomi and you,@Nayuta,
so I decided to be a little more elaborate with@the cooking.

group_1.textLeft: Do not feel indebted.
We are the ones imposing upon you.

group_1.textRight: You let Rabi live in your home in Kamihama,
to help her with her bullying problem,@do you not?

group_1.textLeft: Bullying...

group_1.textRight: Then you'll end up like THEM from back then.

group_1.textLeft: By them you mean Rabi...?!@What on earth did you do?!

group_1.narration: We figured they'd ignore any pressure,@so we pushed them to the edge physically@'til they started breaking down mentally.@Back when the radicals were around,@we'd inflict pain in all sorts of ways.
I didn't join until later so@I don't know all the details,@but the Rabi Himuro you're talking about@was one of the ones that went through the vicious bullying.

group_1.textLeft: (Was the reason she came to our home@because of the bullying?)

group_1.textRight: Besides, it was because of the professor that@I also learned about the bullying...
And that's not all.
The professor was the one who watched over her,
helping her meet the minimum attendance required@and getting her to the infirmary.

group_1.textLeft: ...Papa did all of that?@I had no idea at all.

group_1.textRight: He also introduced me to you, Nayuta.
It's better for her to keep her distance from Yukuni.

group_1.textLeft: So she came to me...

group_1.textRight: You two have truly been a huge help.

group_1.textLeft: No...!@Papa aside,
Rabi has been the one helping me.
She always has amazing meals prepared for me.
Really, she is the one who helps me!

group_1.textRight: *Giggle*...
I can see why Rabi is so relaxed@when she is with you, Nayuta.

group_1.textLeft: Relaxed...?

group_1.textRight: I think that girl's found comfort in belonging@in her new place.
The way she looks at you, she's really at peace.
So truly, thank you so much, Nayuta.

group_1.textLeft: N-not at all...!@I am the one who should be thankful...!
(...But thinking about the situation Rabi@and the others are in,)
(there isn't anything I can do for them...)
(To belong in a new place...)
(...A "new" place?)
(...Could that mean)
(the other Folklore girls came to Kamihama)
(not only for their group's objective,)
(but as a means to distance themselves@from this city...?)
(Because the place they belong@was taken from them...?)
(I cannot imagine such a thing...)
